No haystack. Just needles.

Menzies Search specializes in recruiting and placing the Twin Cities' best marketing communications and advertising industry professionals. Now you don't have to waste valuable time sorting through hundreds of resumes and screening countless numbers of candidates. I can deliver the candidate you're looking for right to your door. Contact me today, and let me do the legwork for you.

About Menzies Search

Comfort is key

Menzies Search has a simple philosophy: It's all about comfort. By listening to my clients and getting to know my candidates, I'm able to make matches that fit perfectly - and are mutually beneficial to both parties.

Since starting this business, I've found the best candidates are discovered by taking the time to learn about their career goals, aspirations and dreams. I uncover what they loved about their last job, and what they didn't. I assess their skills objectively. And I keep in touch regularly.

That same philosophy applies to my clients. By listening intently and talking openly, I'm able to truly assess not just the assignment, but the environment as well. That way, I'm able to deliver the candidates best suited to fit both short and long-term needs.

I pride myself on keeping everyone's best interests at heart, and building bonds and relationships that grow stronger through the years. Maybe that's why clients and candidates are comfortable enough to stay in touch with me long after an assignment is over.

Meet Donna Menzies


Hi. I'm Donna Menzies. I specialize in recruiting and placing advertising and marketing communication professionals.

I started Menzies Search in 2000. Prior to becoming an executive recruiter, I spent 15 years in account management at nationally known agencies like Campbell Mithun, Carlson Marketing Group and Rapp Collins Worldwide. That experience taught me firsthand the skills needed to excel in the communications field — and how to spot those skills in individuals.

Today I use that part-knowledge-part-intuition to help people find new opportunities, and help companies find employees that exceed their expectations. My knack for staying on top of the business, and my insider's knowledge on who's good at what and who's ready to make a change, make me uniquely qualified to match personnel to position — and make my clients' lives a lot easier.

So whether your company is located in Minneapolis, or you're looking to hire from one of the strongest advertising communities in the country, let me do the legwork in finding the perfect fit for your organization.

Case Studies

Problem…

A large national promotions agency needed a Mac Production Supervisor to replace someone who was relocating to a branch office.

Solved

They were so happy with my candidate (and my process) that they've used me to help them with four other searches to date: Creative Director, Associate Creative Director, Sr. Art Director, and Jr. Art Director.

_________________

Problem…

A non-profit corporation wanted to bring their agency services in-house so they could better manage their media dollars.

Solved

After being referred to them by the same agency they let go, I helped them find a Media Planner and Assistant Media Buyer to round out their team.

_________________

Problem…

A national retailer hired me to fill a management position in their in-house agency that had been open for about a year. The strict requirements of this position narrowed the pool of candidates significantly.

Solved

My candidate met all of their requirements -- education, experience and salary. He was the first candidate I brought them.

_________________

Problem…

A small design firm wanted an Account Supervisor who wasn't shy about making new business contacts.

Solved

I delivered a candidate who had spent time as a partner in a small design firm, where she handled both new business and account service responsibilities. The client appreciated having an employee who understood the challenges of running a business. And the candidate was thrilled to have more than one co-worker again!

_________________

Problem…

A national full-service ad agency had grown their B2B public relations accounts and needed the talents of an experienced public relations Account Supervisor.

Solved

I delivered the one and only candidate they ever had to interview.

_________________

Problem…

A design firm where I had placed a designer and account executive was trying to fill an office manager/receptionist position. After interviewing candidates another search firm (who specializes in Admin but not Agencies) had supplied, the owner wanted to see if I could help them.

Solved

Within a week they interviewed three candidates and brought two back for second interviews. Their new office manager/receptionist was hired within two weeks of calling Menzies Search.

_________________

Problem…

An interactive agency called after being frustrated with another search firm's efforts to find them an HR Director. The candidates they brought them were all too junior and had no previous agency experience.

Solved

Within a few weeks I brought them four candidates, three of whom they invited back for a second interview.



 

For Employers

Make it easy on yourself.

Finding qualified candidates is a time-consuming, expensive and sometimes overwhelming proposition. If you've ever put out a search, you know the drill: place ad, get inundated with resumes, try to find the few needles in the haystack, set up interviews, cross fingers, get disappointed, start all over again.

Use Menzies Search and all you need to do is place a phone call. I'm connected to the best quality marketing communication and advertising professionals the Twin Cities has to offer: Professionals seasoned in every marketing discipline, including direct response, web and promotions. From creatives to account supervisors to production managers to planners, my candidates come pre-screened, pre-qualified and pre-matched to fit the position you're looking to fill.

With Menzies Search, you'll benefit from:

  • Confidentiality - Both inside and outside the organization.
  • Access - With over 20 years of experience in the business, my database is filled with the names of the best marketing communication professionals in the industry.
  • Speed - Because all my candidates are pre-screened, I can save you time and headaches by bringing forward only candidates who qualify for the position.
  • Cost Savings - By saving you time, I'm also reducing your financial burden.
  • Objectivity - Sometimes, an outsider can help clarify and assess the real need in an open position - and then deliver a candidate with the skills you didn't know you needed, but are glad you got.
  • A true partner - The more I work with you, the better able I'll be to go beyond the resume to deliver candidates who not only fit the job description, but fit your company's culture, as well.

Call Menzies Search 952-930-3386 to start the conversation.


THE STEPS TO A GOOD WORKING RELATIONSHIP.

Communication is key at Menzies Search.

That's why I invite dialogue throughout the process. Finding you the right person happens only when I have a clear understanding of your specific business situation and needs. Of course, anything you share will be kept confidential.

  1. Provide as much search information as you can. A job description along with specific details related to salary, reporting structure and compensation help both of us define and determine the job search.
  2. Approach every candidate I offer with respect and honesty. Resumes and interviews should be handled in a way that encourages -not discourages, job procurement. Keep in mind your treatment of candidates during the hiring process is what stays with them.
  3. Provide feedback. If you think someone is great, let me know. Or, if I've missed the mark, an honest conversation will help get the search back on track.
  4. Tell me if a search is cancelled or put on hold. If the status of a search changes, it's important I know as soon as possible.
  5. Be realistic about your timing. Each search is different and can be time-consuming. Finding three qualified candidates can often take weeks or months. But, the time I spend is time you save.

Call Donna Menzies at Menzies Search 952-930-3386 to start the conversation.



Search smarter. Search faster.

Getting started is as easy as giving me a call. But to expedite your search and help me pinpoint the right candidate more quickly, I'll need as much information as possible. That's why I encourage you to be ready with:

  • Job Description - A written job description for the positions you want to fill.
  • Salary and Benefits - Salary ranges and benefits package help define the level of talent you are looking for.
  • Contact Person -The decision-makers for hiring available position(s).
  • Deal-breakers - Any mandatories regarding candidates' qualifications.

Of course, I'll also want to know things like, why the position is open (new or replacing), candidate attributes you're looking for, account or industry experience needs, and any educational requirements.

Then, all you need to do is sign my contract and we are ready to go.

Together we'll finalize the screening and interviewing process to best fit your schedule.



 

For Candidates

The best network money can't buy

As a communications professional, you know the benefits of networking. As an executive recruiter, all I do is network all day long. By becoming a Menzies Search candidate, you can start tapping into my growing network today.

From creatives to account executives to production managers to planners, my candidates are the best of the best: with experience in all disciplines and working environments. As for my clients, they represent the most respected agencies and in-house marketing departments in town.

So whether you're currently looking for a job, or are happily employed but just want to keep your options open, sign up with me and you'll be considered for some of the most sought-after job openings available.



Maximizing the recruiter relationship

If you're looking for a full-time job, working with a good executive recruiter should be a part of your job search efforts. Recruiters are connected, informed, and don't cost you a thing.

But regardless of which recruiter you end up working with, there are several things you should know to maximize the relationship — and increase the potential for placement.

They aren't your personal job search bot

  • Recruiters work for their client (the agency or company), not you (the candidate). That's why they don't cost you a thing.

You are their most valuable asset

  • Good recruiters are only as good as the candidates in their database. So trust that if your skills and experience fit a search they're conducting, they'll definitely give you a call.

They get paid when you get hired

  • Most independent recruiters are "contingent", which means they are paid only if they make a placement. They are paid a percentage based on the candidate's negotiated starting salary.
  • Large recruiting firms usually work on "retainer", which means they get paid throughout the recruiting process whether they are successful or not.
  • A recruiter's payment does not affect or come out of your salary.

Not all recruiters are created equal

  • Ask colleagues and networking contacts for referrals to good recruiters.
  • Consider recruiters that specialize in your area of expertise or desired geographic location.

Meet, greet and grill

  • Try to meet with the recruiter in person to find out how they operate.
  • Find out the types of clients they've worked with, and the types of candidates they've placed.
  • Decide if you want to work with them. If so, give them "permission" to keep your resume on file.

You control your resume

  • A reputable recruiter will always discuss an opportunity with you prior to presenting your resume to a potential employer.

Honesty is the best policy

  • Once you've decided to work with a recruiter, be candid about your salary and position requirements. They can't present you unless they know what you're looking for.
  • If they send you on an interview, contact them afterwards to discuss your interest and provide feedback on how it went.
  • If you've already approached a client company yourself or through a networking source (and your resume is on file with them), tell your recruiter.

Keep in touch. Just keep it to a minimum

  • Develop a relationship with a recruiter by keeping them up to date on your career.
  • If you've accepted a new job or received a promotion, send your recruiter an updated resume to ensure their database stays current.
  • Recruiters use their database to contact candidates that match their client's job specifications - and sometimes, the best career opportunities come when you aren't looking. (Client companies use recruiters to source candidates who aren't necessarily job hunting.) So provide recruiters with updated contact information (phone, address, e-mail). If we can't get in touch with you, your perfect job may never be presented to you.
  • Don't follow up with a recruiter excessively — unless you are in the process of interviewing with one of their clients.


You are what you show

In this business, your eyes aren't the window to your soul, your portfolio is. It's also the door to a world of opportunity. That's why it's crucial to give your portfolio the same attention to detail that you would any creative challenge.

Tips for putting together a strong portfolio

First things first

Your resume is your first portfolio piece and must make a good impression. Your choice of typography, layout, information, even paper stock, contribute to what that impression will be. Don't underestimate or short-shrift this important piece of paper.

Put your best piece forward

Your opening sample should be your best, most provoking piece — a springboard into conversation about your work. Leave your next best piece for last, to leave a lasting impression.

8 is the loneliest number

Somewhere between 10 and 20 samples is best. Too many pieces can send mixed signals, as it will invariably be padded with weaker pieces. Make sure you have enough to demonstrate the breadth and depth of your abilities. Still, less is more if all the pieces are strong. Quantity is not a substitute for quality.

Good work speaks for itself

Your work should demonstrate your ability to think strategically. Use stronger pieces as opportunities to talk about your strategic thinking or any special skills you used to execute the project. Your samples should communicate that you can execute on that strategy.

Think paper dolls

Create a portfolio that gives you the flexibility to add and subtract work easily: one that fits a common format. This will give you the ability to customize your portfolio for each interview. The creative samples you take to the interview should match the position you are interviewing for.

Cleanliness counts

Always make sure your samples are clean. You will be showing your pieces to people who recognize and appreciate high quality work. Don't put yourself in the position of having to apologize for materials that are damaged.

Think body double

Create a portfolio that can speak for itself. You may not always have the luxury of being present when it's viewed. So consider adding a brief paragraph for each piece with a statement of the challenge and how you solved it.

Remember your manners

A thank you note that reflects your personality or the design of your resume is not only polite; it's another opportunity to market yourself. Create a leave-behind piece that showcases your strongest pieces. Use a format that will fit in a file drawer, if possible. The interviewer may be looking to hire someone in the future, and you want to be within his or her reach.

Twin Cities Based Searches . . .

Senior Designer — DESIGN

This opening is for a brand-package designer with a strong portfolio who has experience with brand-marks and packaging systems. The ideal candidate will have experience with food products and/or consumer retail products. Level open (from skilled junior to 5+ years experience).

Production/Traffic Manager — AGENCY

Searching for a mid-level production and traffic manager with strong project management experience to act as a liaison between Account, Creative, Media and Interactive, and to work with vendors producing materials. Outstanding interpersonal skills as well as an articulate, friendly, "whatever it takes" attitude. 4+ years of relevant experience required. Degree preferred, but relevant work experience will be considered.

Senior Account Director

The Sr. Account Director will provide strategic leadership on the account. Must be able to own, manage and develop business by providing brand consultation, perspective and recommendations to clients to prosper their business. As the direct point of contact between the client and the agency, the Sr. Account Director will be expected to provide clients with a distinct point-of-view on marketing, creative strategies, target audience, competitive set, trends, and opportunities for building brand awareness, competitive point of difference, and relevance/preference with the target audience. Experience with CPG and Package Design required.

New Business Director

This top notch design firm is on the hunt for a strategic new business person with previous promotions or design agency experience. Must have experience with CPG clients or clients who have a need for kid centric marketing programs to leverage the creative team's design and illustration talent.

Designer — RETAIL PACKAGING

Need a talented designer for a branding and package design agency. Must have experience with branding, packaging and higher end print campaign work.

Director of Business Development

This Interactive agency is looking for a new business leader with experience identifying potential clients and pursuing them. This person will also partner with the Account Services team to drive and close opportunities with existing clients. Experienced in marketing, this person will be involved in determining how the agency will market itself and identifying the tools necessary for engaging potential clients and closing new business. Must be willing to set sales goals, create processes and plans for accomplishing those goals.

MENZIES SEARCH -- Equal Opportunity Policy

Consistent with federal, state, and local law, Menzies Search, LLC will provide equal opportunity to all qualified candidates and will not discriminate on the basis of certain factors, including but not limited to, race, color, sex, religion or religious creed, national origin, medical condition, development of physical disability, marital status, ancestry, socioeconomic status, ethnic background, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, or military status.

MENZIES SEARCH -- Privacy Policy

We designed our web site to allow visitors — employers and candidates — to learn about and interact with Menzies Search, LLC. We hope you find the site helpful.

We gather general information on our web site traffic and we may share this information with third-party vendors who can help us analyze this traffic.

We gather personally-identifiable information when you volunteer to provide it. If you submit your resume, for example, you may also provide your name, address, e-mail address, phone number(s), fax number, as well as your resume and cover letter. If you choose not to disclose such information, we may be unable to provide the information you seek or to consider you for employment opportunities. Whenever you supply us information through this web site, you grant us permission to use this information to contact you and to evaluate your suitability for current or future job openings. You also authorize us to store your information and to send you mail or e-mail concerning Menzies Search, LLC business.

If you give us permission to present you as a candidate to a prospective employer, you authorize us to provide your contact information and other personally-identifiable information to the prospective employer, to verify your credentials, and to conduct background checks.

Menzies Search, LLC reserves the right to enlist outside vendors to process personally-identifiable information for us. These vendors are obligated to keep such information confidential, to keep it only for benefit of Menzies Search, LLC, and to refrain from releasing it to any third parties.

We will provide personally-identifiable data to government authorities only as required by law.
